titles: A testimony against gaming, musick, dancing, singing, swearing and peoples calling upon God to damn them. As also against drinking to excess, whoring, lying, and cheating. Commended to the consciences of all people in the sight of God, but more especially to those, who keep publick houses.
author: Kelsall, John.
publisher: Printed by T. Sowle, at the Crooked Billet in Holloway-Lane, Shoreditch; and are to be sold near the Meeting-House in White-Hart-Court in Crace-Church-street,
notes: Place of publication supplied by cataloger.
Torn; print faded, with some loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the Friends House Library, London.
keywords: Conduct of life --  Early works to 1800.
Dance --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
Gambling --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
Singing --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
Swearing --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
